newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Baltic Shipping sells ship for two bln rbls.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Shipping sells ship for two bln rbls.

text.p: Baltic Shipping has sold one of the three ships frozen by a Kirov regional court for 2.02 billion roubles, a court official said on Tuesday.
An unnamed company bought the tugboat Kapitan Aristov at an auction on October 21, where the starting price was 2.00 billion roubles, the official told Reuters.
She said a bid for the other tugboat Kapitan Volodin had been withdrawn at the last moment and there were no bids for the steamship Priozersk.
A repeat auction to sell the two boats will take place at the start of November, she said.
The auction was organised by the court, which seized the ships after employees of AO Baltiskoye Morskoye Parokhodstvo (Baltic Shipping) sued the company for wage arrears.
All the proceeds from the auction would be used to cover wage debts, a court official said previously.
The government is seeking to take a controlling stake in the troubled company, which posted 215.82 billion roubles in losses in 1995, according to Russian accounting standards.
The company's total debt to foreign creditors exceeds $300 million and many of its ships have been seized in foreign ports.
